metadata.Title: CVE-2019-18197 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: In xsltCopyText in transform.c in libxslt 1.1.33, a pointer variable isn't reset under certain circumstances. If the relevant memory area happened to be freed and reused in a certain way, a bounds check could fail and memory outside a buffer could be written to, or uninitialized data could be disclosed.

criterions.comment: libxslt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
